results.brief_description: Uses models and endoscopic photography within a human lung to reveal their structure and workings. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Low back pain
results.brief_description: Looks at the subject of low back pain and injuries. Discusses causes, including lack of exercise and tension and treatment, which includes relaxation and appropriate exercise.

results.title: The Lost wax method of bronze casting
results.creator_credit: Leo Steiner, Fotosonic and Harmon Foundation
results.brief_description: Vincent Kofi, a Ghanian sculptor, is shown making a bronze casting of his “Awakening Africa” using the lost wax method. The process - from modelling the original clay figurine to the finished work on the metal casting - is shown.

results.title: Looking at animals: cattle
results.creator_credit: Peter Boulton, Boulton-Hawker Films and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Illustrates the wide variety of cattle: domestic breeds; including exotic varieties - draught oxen, yaks, wild bison and buffalo. Shows the easily domesticated nature of cattle, their main physical characteristics, and the process of rumination. Includes a sequence showing the birth of a calf.

results.title: Look to the land
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows the wealth of natural resources in the United States and illustrates how they have been wasted or misused in the past. Then tours the country to see new farming methods, the wise management of timber and grazing lands, the co-ordinated development of river basins, and other efforts to preserve the natural heritage.

results.title: The Locker
results.creator_credit: Barry Tomblin and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An experimental film about a young man and his involvement with a mysterious locker. During an interview voices emerge from the locker, later its resence torments him. The situation is treated in a surrealistic manner. Cast: James Dunkley, Paul Smythe, Nancy Gabrielle

results.title: Loch Lomond
results.creator_credit: Laurence Henson, Films of Scotland and IFA (Scotland)
results.brief_description: A study of human and wild life throughout the year, in, on, and around Loch Lomond. Gives a picture of the life and work of a Highland community - the wild life conservator, research biologist, shepherd, farmer and publican, all of whom know the Loch in its many moods.

results.title: Localising troubles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”.
An intercarrier sound receiver using the flyback high voltage supply is used as a typical example in explaining how to identify trouble symptoms and localise them in a specific section of the receiver by studying the three indicators present in the receiver itself - raster, picture and sound.

results.title: Living with the city
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Examines recent developments in the preservation and rehabilitation of inner-city areas of Sydney, Adelaide and Melbourne raising the issue of low-income workers being forced out of these areas by “trendies” and high class shops. Highlights the need to strengthen working relationships between inner-city communities and government emphasising the importance of deeper official understanding of residents’ social and environmental needs. Narrated by Leonard Teale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
